value.value:
A five-day Deoria Tal Chandrashila trek is inviting you to revel in the utmost beauty held by one of the beautiful lakes in the Himalayas as well as the mighty peaks protecting the valleys and villages. The exciting trek starts after you reach Haridwar from where you will be going to Sari passing by the views of the Ganga and Alakananda Rivers and the pilgrim centres of Rishikesh, Devprayag and Rudraprayag will surely let you feel holy. The Mandakini valley you come across before reaching Kund would have many surprises prior to you settling down near the river at the campsite at Sari.
A very enthusiastic yet moderate trek to Deoria Tal may let you witness the quaint hamlets and the temple of Ukhimath and later you need to cross many thickets enriched by the presence of abundant bird species and gradual ascents. Deoria Tal will never disappoint you in terms of the camping and the views from the lake. Chopta fills the post of upcoming destination during the trek. To arrive Chopta, one will have to conquer the not so friendly rhododendron forests.
Tungnath Temple and Chandrashila Peak located at a height of about 4000 meters will be calling you to reach them after beholding the mesmerizing views of hued meadows and pastures. From the top of Chandrashila, get enchanted by the peaks of Nanda Devi, Trishul, Chaukhamba. Following by the time at the peak top, return journey to Haridwar will be ready.

value.heading: About the Destination
value.value:
Deoria Tal Chandrashila Trek with Chopta is a short trek up to the most spellbinding peaks in Garhwal district. The first bit of this trekking journey takes one to Deoria Tal where one can relish the charming beauty of its lake standing at 2438m. It is from the Chaukhamba Peak where one can capture gorgeous views of the Deoria Tal Lake and its mirror-like waters.
The trail leading to Chopta is enveloped in lush green meadows nestled in the lap of the Himalayas. This trail leads one to the Tungnath temple, which stands tall at 3680m and is regarded the highest Shiva shrine in the world. Apart from the exotic flora and fauna caught along the way, one can also feast their eyes with sights of several majestic peaks namely the Bandarpoonch, Kedar and Chaukhamba. After a kilometer-long walk from Tungnath, arrive at the summit of Chandrashila peak at about 4000m. The spectacle offered here comprising of snow-capped peaks and the undulating valleys surrounding the area make this trek well worth it.
There is also the additional experience of lodging at the Himalayan Eco Lodges and Camps at Kund which forms the base for the Deoria Tal Chandrashila trek and overlooks the Mandakini River gushing below the Kedar peak.

details.heading: Deoria Tal and Chandrashila Trek Highlights
details.value:
• Get bewitched by the sections of dense forests, moss-covered trails and pastures enveloping the beautiful villages on this trek. Camp in the middle of the thickets watching the multi coloured meadows.
    • ,
  • Feel enthralled while watching the different birds and take photographs of them. For birders, Deoria Tal is a haven.
  • The summit climb is the major highlight that is ready with the views of Western and Eastern Uttarakhand and from the top, we will feel like highly blessed.

value.heading: Day 1 - Drive from Delhi-Haridwar – Sari (1350 m)
value.value: The ride will entail meandering by the Ganga and Alaknanda Rivers and surpassing the holy towns of Rishikesh, Devprayag and Rudraprayag till you enter the Mandakini valley. Reach Kund by evening and then take a short hike to practice for the next few days’ trekking journey. Settle by the riverside and camp here in a lodge for the night.

value.heading: Day 2 - Trek from Sari – Deoria Tal (2438m and 4-5 hour trek)
value.value: After breakfast, set off on a trekking journey from the lodge through cosy hamlets and the temple township of Ukhimath. Cut through the dense thickets thriving with abundant bird species and continue climbing upwards. Upon arriving at Deoria Tal Lake by afternoon, take some time to uncover the gorgeous environs. Settle down here in the comfort of your camps and get a good night’s sleep.

value.heading: Day 3 - Trek from Deoria Tal – Chopta (2800m and 4-5 hour trek)
value.value: Begin the day with breakfast and a walk on a ridge as well as a series of ascending trails. You will even come across mixed forests of oaks, pines and Rhododendrons. Arrive at the campsite in Chopta by afternoon and spend the rest of the day unearthing the natural treasures of the place which are enhanced by snow-capped mountainous landscapes. By nightfall, put up your camps here and retire for the night after a hearty dinner.

value.heading: Day 4 - Trek from Chopta – Tungnath (3680m) – Chandrashila Peak (4000m and 4-5 hour trek)
value.value: Start off the day by ascending to the slopes to reach Tungnath temple. The several hued pastures here along with the beautiful mountains and valleys serving as the backdrop make for a remarkable sight. Post stacking up on refreshments; resume your trek uphill towards the Chandrashila Peak at 4000m. From the peak, get enchanted by the peaks of Nanda Devi, Trishul, Chaukhamba. Trek down to the base camp at Chopta followed by your lunch and drive back to Delhi.

details.value:

  • Tea/coffee will be served throughout.

details.heading: Transport
details.value: Toyota Innova, Mahindra Xylo, Mahindra Scorpio, Tempo Traveller and no local jeeps or similar vehicles are used except where there are short transfers from the lodge to the trek points. The transport tariff includes all driver charges, fuel, parking, toll and taxes.

details.heading: Things To Carry
details.value:
• A sturdy backpack (60ltrs) with a plastic or water-proof lining
  • High-ankle waterproof (Goretex)trekking shoes with good grip
  • Trekking pole or stick
  • Wardrobe essentials like woollen and fleece clothes, synthetic or waterproof track pants, rain-proof jackets, sunglasses, waterproof gloves, wind-proof jackets, thermal innerwear
  • Moisturizer, Sun Screen Lotion, Lip Balm
  • Personal Medicine Kit
  • Insulated water bottle and hydration pack (optional)
  • Torch / Flashlight (with extra batteries)
  • Extra Polythene bags

details.heading: Clothing
details.value:
• 1 pair of thermals (upper + lower)
  • 2 pairs of Quick Dry Warm lower or Track Pants.
  • Full sleeves T-shirts/ Sweatshirts.
  • 2-3 pair of socks
  • Undergarments. Qty - 1 for every day of trekking
  • 1 warm/feather jacket
  • Gloves and head cover

details.heading: Advisory
details.value:
• Travel in small groups
  • Proper waste disposal
  • Respect local cultures and be sensitive towards wildlife
  • Porter services for carrying personal belongings throughout the trek (not more than 10 kgs) are optional additions that can be availed for Rs. 800
  • Personal trekking gear and that can be availed at an additional cost
  • General precautions and steps are to be taken to initiate good acclimatization with the assistance of guides
  • Those suffering from an ailment or heart disease, Diabetes, breathing problems, high altitude sickness or is pregnant cannot participate in this trek
